intro: Herbichia carpatica, commonly known as the Carpathian herbichia, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
